title: Is Daniel leaving Coronation Street following Sinead’s death?
text:
Daniel has been left devastated after Sinead’s untimely death. (Picture: ITV)

It has been an emotional fortnight for Coronation Street fans as it was finally time to say goodbye to Sinead Tinker (Katie McGlynn) as she lost her battle with cervical cancer, leaving behind her devastated husband Daniel Osbourne (Rob Mallard) and their baby son, Bertie.

Corrie viewers have praised the emotional storyline and the performances of both Katie and Rob, while Metro.co.uk’s Duncan Lindsay described the build up to Sinead’s death and Friday night’s heart-breaking show as: ‘episodes for the show’s history books.’

This week, viewers will see a broken Daniel struggle to organise his late wife’s funeral before deciding to leave for Scotland with his son, in need of a break after Sinead’s tragic death.

But with Daniel struggling to come to terms with Sinead’s death and leaving Weatherfield, will he actually come back to the cobbles?

Is Daniel leaving Coronation Street?

As Daniel sets off for Scotland with Bertie, an upset Beth watches on, worried that she’ll never see her godson or Daniel again – and viewers share her concerns.

TONIGHT AT 7.30 & 8.30PM – How will Beth react when she finds Bethany comforting Daniel in Victoria Gardens?#Corrie #Daniel pic.twitter.com/XdTB6aVJZQ — Coronation Street (@itvcorrie) October 28, 2019

However, luckily for Corrie fans, actor Rob Mallard isn’t leaving Coronation Street, meaning that his character will return from his break in Scotland soon.

Despite trying to avoid Sinead’s funeral, it has been confirmed that Daniel will return to say a final goodbye to his late wife, as Rob Mallard has been pictured filming Sinead’s funeral scenes on a rainy day in Manchester with other members of the Corrie cast.

The funeral episodes look set to be just as devastating to watch as the scenes on Friday night when Sinead passed away. How Daniel will cope without his beloved wife and as a newly single parent remains to be seen and viewers will need to stay tuned to find out.

Coronation Street continues tonight at 7.30pm and 8.30pm on ITV.
